result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan R Person

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[MK] cases #22CF385, #22CT338, #22CT365 called at 3:34pm  
Defendant Jonathan R Person in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa.  ADA Jeffrey Shock in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney De La Rosa requests that the preliminary hearing be scheduled [in case #22CF385] as soon as possible.  
Both counsel agree to scheduling of the preliminary hearing on November 17th. 
recess 3:38pm

NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing (along with already set Bail Forfeiture Hearing) in the felony case, and Status Conference on the remaining cases--all on November 17th at 9:30am.  The Court has granted Attorney De La Rosa leave to file a bond modification motion on this same date/time, inserting November 17th at 9:30am on the Notice of Motion/Motion.
Status conference on November 1, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

[ma] Cases 22CF385, 22CT338, 22CT365 called at 1:43pm 
Defendant Jonathan R Person appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Kayla Barteck. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

Bond Arguments given by Counsel

In Case 22CF385, the Court requires a $100 CASH bond, with conditions to continue. 
In Case 22CT338, the Court requires a $25 CASH bond, with conditions to continue. 
In Case 22CT365, the Court requires a $25 CASH bond, with conditions to continue. 

Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing to remain scheduled. 
recess 1:51  pm. 

NEXT: Status Conference on 11/1/22 at 3:15pm
Returnable to any Jefferson County Magistrate.

[ml] Cases 22CF385, 22CT338, and 22CT365 called at 10:15AM
Defendant Jonathan R Person DOES NOT appear.  Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court for Jonathan R Person. ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Parson verifies Victim Witness Compliance.

Att De La Rosa cannot provide an explanation for the Defendant's non-appearance.

Att Parson confirms that the Defendant is not in custody in the Jefferson County Jail.

On Motion of the State, the Court issues a Bench Warrant, Body Only, in each file, returnable to any Jefferson County Magistrate. 

On Motion of the State, the Court orders that previously posted bond be found in default, and instructs that a Bail Bond Forfeiture hearing.

recess 10:18AM

NEXT: Schedule Bail Bond Forfeiture Hearing in file 22CF385

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel - Att De La Rosa
Status conference on September 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Order to Seal Victim Key
The original document was titled: Victim Witness Key_1 - Person, Jonathan R.pdf
The original history event date is: 08-23-2022

[ml] Cases 22CF385 and 22CT365 called at 1:56PM
Defendant Jonathan R Person appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffery De La Rosa (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Att De La Rosa affirms that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

Att De La Rosa confirms an address for the Defendant: 2015 Vondron Rd, Madison, WI 53716
Att De La Rosa states that while he is not raising competency at this point in time, it may arise again at another time.

As to file 22CF385:
The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

As to file 22CT365:
The Defendant verifies that the date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint is correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Plea of "Not Guilty" are entered; speedy trial is waived by both parties.

As to file 22CF385:
The Court requires a $250.00 Cash Bond with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence

As to file 22CT365:
The Court requires a $350.00 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license

recess 2:06PM
NEXT: 
As to both files: Status Conference on 09/30 at 10:00AM (to track along with the Defendant's other file) (JA, note in comments - file 22CF385 is still at the Preliminary Hearing stage)
